New Records: The Cavaliers improved to 30-4, swept a four-game Western Conference road trip and are now 10-0 against the West.
Key Match Events: Evan Mobley had 34 points and 10 rebounds as the Cavaliers ran their winning streak to nine games by beating the short-handed Dallas Mavericks 134-122.
Back-to-back 3s by Klay Thompson pulled the Mavericks within 64-53 with 44 seconds left in the half.
The Cavaliers closed with five straight points, Caris LeVert getting a friendly bounce on a left-corner 3 with four seconds left, to lead 69-53 at halftime.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mavericks played without both of their All-Star guards, Luka Doncic and Kyrie Irving.
Post-Match Reflections: The Cavaliers used a 20-point run to go from a 21-17 deficit late in the first period to a 37-21 lead early in the second.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks have lost four straight to match a season long losing streak.
The Cavaliers outscored the Mavericks 18-0 in first-half turnover points and matched a season low with eight overall, two in the first half.
Others: The Cavaliers will host the Charlotte Hornets on Sunday night. The Mavericks visit the Memphis Grizzlies on Monday night.
